Q_DESC:
Rahul is a geek. Head's is the lucky call for him. You have to make him completely lucky. You are provided N coins. If the coin is heads facing upwards it means he is lucky else unlucky, your task is to do an magical operation to make him lucky. Magical operation is as follows (starting index from 1) if you find any coin heads facing downwards flip the coin of i index and i+1 index.  
Input:
The first line consists of T test cases. Each test case consists of 2 lines. The first line contains an integer N, denoting the number of coins in a row. The second line contains N letters, containing H or T (denoting head facing upwards and tail facing upwards respectively).
Output:
For each test case output on the first line an integer X, denoting the number of operations you intend to make for making all the coins head face upwards.
On the next line of the output, print X space separated integers, denoting the order in which you want to carry on the magic operations on any of the N coins.
TESTCASE_1:
2
3
H H H
5 
H T H T H
###---###SEPERATOR---###---
0

2
2 3
TESTCASE_2:
2
7
H H H T T T H
5 
H T H T H
###---###SEPERATOR---###---
3
4 6 7 
2
2 3
